english: to dress up, to adorn oneself
to suffer from, to be afflicted by
to adduce, to cite as proof
to deal with, to be about
to glimpse, to make out dimly
to wound with words, to mortify
to mop up plate, to scrape clean
to revel, to take great pleasure
creole, of Spanish descent born in Americas
to call at port; to turn up
to take root; to become rooted
to amuse oneself; to take comfort
to delight in; to amuse oneself
magic trick; as if by magic
